intro: Argyreia ionantha, commonly known as the sacred lotus of Hawaii, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its cultural significance, it is also known as the "flower of the gods" in Hawaiian tradition.
